with the same smile. 
"But that is my conviction, and judging by the last letter with which His Highness the Archduke Ferdinand has honored me, I imag- ine that the Austrian troops, under the direc- tion of so skillful a leader as General Mack, have by now already gained a decisive victory and no longer need our aid," said Kutuzov. 
The general frowned. Though there was no definite news of an Austrian defeat, there were many circumstances confirming the unfavor- able rumors that were afloat
